page.title: 17CARMYLE/HISTORIC MONUMENTS
page.content: {CARMYLE}is a village which originally housed workers in the adjacent Steel works.There are some mature stone houses but most of the estate consists of a mature council house estate.The village has a close sense of identity and community.Various community events such as bingo and junior football take place in the village.It lies on the north bank of the Clyde.Some local youths were swimming in the river when we visited. {A DOVECOTE(18th century)}lies in the grounds of the sewerage works.It is one of only three left in the country. The National Trust have plans to restore it.It belonged to the Daldowie Estate.{A Family TOMB}is built into a hillside in the crematorium grounds. {A MONUMENT TO THE MINES}in the form of pit winding gear is in Cambuslang Industrial Estate.
